news.title: Take the right steps for your career by exploring the fantastic courses at this city college
news.text: Maybe it's because we're seeing the last of the summer weather or because the holiday season has officially ended, but September always feels like the beginning of a new year - and with it comes the opportunity to do something new. Autumn 2022 could be the perfect chance to level up your career prospects by pursuing a new qualification or by getting back into education after a long time. And there's no better place to start than BMet College. With three campuses located across the city and a wealth of opportunities for school leavers and adult learners, the college has something to suit everyone's needs. From A-Levels, to apprenticeships, B-Tec courses, HNDs or HNCs, foundation degrees and access to higher education courses that help students gain entry to university, opportunities are available at all levels for anyone aged 16 years and up. Plus, with enrolment continuing throughout Autumn 2022, there’s no need for learners to wait until January to start. BMet's three sites - James Watt College, Matthew Boulton College, and Sutton Coldfield College, are well equipped with state-of-the-art facilities and highly knowledgable tutors to give students all of the skills and confidence they need to succeed. And with great employer links across Birmingham, learners can rest assured they'll leave with the experience they need to thrive in the working world. If school leavers believe they're currently on a course that's not quite right for them, it’s not too late to come and talk to BMet and change their options. The college also offers students the chance to re-sit their English and maths qualifications while they study towards a career-orientated course. Adult learners can benefit from part-time courses and studying around work and family commitments. The college's access to higher education and university-level courses offer competitive tuition fees and smaller class sizes to give students the specialist support they need. Pat Carvalho, principal of BMet College, says: "We have a great range of over 100 courses to choose from at the college. From subjects such as Level 1 English and maths, business and professional, health and social care, dance, music, dental, art and design, travel and tourism, media and games, construction plus many more - there's plenty to help everyone get ready for their dream career. "All of our sites are also easily accessible by public transport. And the college can help signpost learners to the appropriate financial support and government loans they need to study with us. "With children back in school again, we want to encourage parents in the local area to pursue their studies with us and have their time to shine. And there's also lots on offer for school leavers who didn't get the GCSEs they were quite expecting - we can help them get back on track with courses that lead to university, employment and more." Excellent resources All three of BMet College's campuses have their own unique character and offer an exciting student experience. Modern buildings and well-equipped classrooms help students get the most out of their studies, with spacious learning areas stocked with PCs and course materials. There are also specialist workshops and laboratories dependent on each subject area, designed to give students a glimpse of the working world. Libraries and private study areas can help give learners the space and amenities they need to prepare for exams and assessment periods too. Fantastic work experience opportunities BMet partners with local employers in Birmingham, ensuring students have the hands-on skills they need to enter the world of work after they leave college. Students who are on a vocational course will be encouraged to complete 35 hours of work experience relevant to their studies. The college's work placement coordinators will help ease students through their work placement journey. They will also be encouraged to build their confidence, communication skills and relationship with employers during their placement. Degree-level courses from great universities BMet College works in partnership with local universities to deliver degree-level courses, including with the University of Wolverhampton, Birmingham City University and the University of Worcester. Students can study courses at Level 4 and onwards, including HNCs, HNDs, foundation degrees and PGCE courses. Part-time and flexible entry options make study easier, and BMet's online learning facilities are also second-to-none. Many of the college's tuition fees are cheaper than the national average too, which are capped at £9,250 per anum. Brilliant student support As well as having a range of financial support packages aimed at taking the stress out of study, BMet's tutors are able to talk through progression opportunities with students at each stage of their development journey. Performance coaches can also help give learners further career advice, create a CV, search for job roles and prepare UCAS statements for university study. Students who require extra learning support can take advantage of the in-house mentoring service, which helps to tackle problems such as time management, self-esteem, and motivation. For those who want to discuss any concerns or worries in a safe environment without judgement, BMet's counselling service is on hand to help. For more information about BMet College and details of how to enrol for a course in September 2022, visit the website here.
news.author: Manisha Bhanot

news.title: Bullring, Merry Hill, Touchwood and other shopping centre opening hours on day of Queen's funeral
news.text: Shopping centres will be closing their doors across the region as the nation says farewell to Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. The late monarch's funeral will take place on Monday, September 19. The day of the funeral has been declared a bank holiday - meaning many places including attractions, shops, restaurants and leisure facilities are closing for the whole, or part of the day. This includes some of the region's biggest shopping centres. Many will close for the day in a mark of respect for The Queen - reopening on September 20. However some will remain open for shops that have chosen to continue trading on the day. Read more: Shops, attractions and venues in and around Birmingham closing for the Queen's funeral Government guidance says: "Organisations may choose to close on the day of the State Funeral, however there is no obligation to do so and this is at the discretion of individual organisations. As with other organisations, these institutions may wish to display or share images of previous Royal visits, particularly if they are one of Her Majesty's patronages." Here are all the details of whether shopping centres will be open or closed, including opening hours on Monday, September 19, for all the major shopping centres in the West Midlands. We will update this list as we know more. Bullring and Grand Central A spokesman for the Bullring and Grand Central confirmed the centre will be open on the day of The Queen's funeral. It will operate normal bank holiday opening hours - between 10am and 7pm. However, a number of stores will be closed on Monday. A spokesman for Bullring and Grand Central said: "We will be open bank holiday hours which will be 10am to 7pm however some stores will be closing. There will be a list on our website of stores which will be closed." The Fort The Fort has not yet released any details on whether it will be open or closed on the day of the Queen's funeral. One of its largest stores, Primark, has announced all its stores will close however. We will bring you more information when we have it. Resorts World Resorts World will remain open for visitors on Monday. However there will be some stores at the centre that will be closed. The shopping centre will provide updates on stores that will be open or closed on September 19 on their website in the coming days. It will operate normal bank holiday hours - 10am to 6pm. The centre's Resorts World Casino, Cineworld cinema and Vortex Gaming will also be closed. Touchwood Touchwood in Solihull will remain open on Monday as a Book of Condolence is located in The Core. But not all of the shops at the centre will be open. John Lewis, one of the centre's largest stores, has already announced its closure on the day of the Queen's funeral. Centre bosses said individual retailers will make their own decisions on when to open - and visitors should check directly with them before visiting. A spokesman for Touchwood said: "Touchwood will remain open to provide access to the Book of Condolence in The Core and the Floral Tributes in Jubilee Gardens but John Lewis have already informed us of their decision to close on Monday. "Individual retailers will make their own decisions over whether to trade on this day or whether they will be adjusting their trading hours accordingly. As such, we advise visitors to check individual store websites before visiting." Most restaurants will be open but with varying trading hours. The Touchwood car park will remain open as normal, however, the John Lewis car park will close on Sunday evening at 8pm and reopen on Tuesday morning at 6.30am. Merry Hill Merry Hill will remain open on Monday - for some of the stores that have opted to continue trading. The Brierley Hill -based shopping centre will operate bank holiday opening hours. Bosses are urging anyone planning to visit the centre to check individual stores opening hours before making a journey to the centre. A list of those open or closed has not yet been made available. A spokesperson for Merry Hill said: "We are deeply saddened by the passing of Her Majesty The Queen. We join everyone in Dudley, the UK and further afield in thanking her for her decades of service as a pillar of strength and devotion. "On behalf of the stores that remain open on Monday, September 19, Merry Hill will operate Bank Holiday hours between 10am – 6pm. However, we ask our visitors to check the latest opening hours with stores and brands directly before setting off on their journey. "At this time of national mourning our thoughts continue to be with the Royal Family." Mander Centre Wolverhampton's Mander Centre will also remain open on Monday, September 19. The centre will operate bank holiday opening hours between 10am and 5pm. Centre bosses say their website will be updated with what stores will still be open on Monday. The only one listed currently is Boots. Boots will be open between 8am and 6pm on Monday, however it will be closed between 11am and 1pm. The pharmacy will remain open for urgent prescriptions. A spokesman for the Mander Centre said: "The centre will be open for stores that wish to remain open, and our website will provide detail of which stores these are." Telford Shopping Centre Telford Shopping Centre has also not yet revealed whether it will be open or closed on September 19. Any updates will be released via their social media channels. New Square Shopping Centre West Bromwich 's New Square Shopping Centre will remain open on September 19 - but a number of stores and restaurants at the site will be closed. The closures include Tesco, Next, JD Sports, H&M, River Island, Greggs, Specsavers, O2, The Entertainer, Primark, Pandora, Sports Direct and Costa. The full list of closures can be found on New Square's website. Vodafone will open between 12.30pm and 4.30pm, while Harvester will open between 1pm and 9pm. Turquoise Kitchen opens between 4pm and 11.30pm, and Nando's between 4pm and 11pm. The Interceptor is yet to confirm its opening hours. Normal opening hours will apply at Sprinkles, Mr Singhs, WrapChic and Subway. McArthurGlen Designer Outlet West Midlands The McArthurGlen Designer Outlet West Midlands, near Cannock, will be closed on Monday. The centre will reopen again the following day, Tuesday, September 20. A spokesman for the McArthurGlen Designer Outlet West Midlands said: "Following the sad news that Queen Elizabeth II has passed away, we are joining the nation in mourning as we close our UK centres on Monday, September 19, the day of Her Majesty’s funeral. The West Midlands Centre will resume normal trading hours on Tuesday, September 20." Ryemarket Shopping Centre Stourbridge's Ryemarket Shopping Centre will be closed on Monday. Pump Gyms at the centre however will remain open. On Twitter the centre posted: "The centre will be closed on September 19 as a mark of respect for the state funeral of Her Majesty Queen Elizabeth II. This closure may affect the adjoining council operated car park. "Pump Gyms remains open 24 hours via High Street only." news.title: Moment BMW gets stuck in reverse and smashes into parked vehicles outside Tesco car wash

news.title: Prince Harry spends his birthday mourning the Queen
news.text: Today is Harry's 38th birthday, and marks first time in years he has spent it in UK. Duke lives in a $14 million mansion in the US having stepped back from duty. Believed to have marked last two birthdays with Meghan and their children. Today will prove different as he continues to mourn the loss of his grandmother. news.title: Tories back calls for late Queen to be know as Elizabeth the Faithful
news.text: Senior politicians including Boris Johnson have referred to Elizabeth the Great. But Security Minister Tom Tugendhat referred to her as 'the Faithful' last week. Former Tory treasurer Lord Farmer said Great was used by many rulers in history. They included Genghis Khan, King Herod and other rulers seen badly by history
news.author: David Wilcock

news.title: Lady Susan Hussey, 81, pays her final goodbye to Queen
news.text: Photos captured the Queen's lady-in-waiting paying her respects to the Queen. Lady Susan Hussey, 81, has been by the Queen's side for more than six decades. Was present at key events, including at several State Openings of Parliament. The public will continue to pay their respects today inside Westminster Hall. news.title: Gigi Hadid steps out amid Leonardo DiCaprio rumours
news.text: Gigi Hadid opted for a casual look as she headed to work (Picture: Backgrid/ Getty) Gigi Hadid seemed unfazed about the media attention she’s been receiving in recent days, as she strolled through New York to attend her next fashion show. The supermodel has been the subject of romance chatters alongside Leonardo DiCaprio, 47, with speculation emerging that the duo are ‘getting to know’ one another. However, the 27-year-old appeared relaxed as she strolled through the Big Apple before she walked the runway for Tom Ford at New York Fashion Week. Gigi cut a casual fit as she headed to the high-fashion event in denim cargo style, low-rise jeans and a navy shirt that only had the top two buttons done up. She finished the look with a black leather blazer, matching handbag, chunky black boots and dark rounded sunglasses. The mother of one let her blonde hair hang loose and untamed over her shoulders, as she added minimal gold jewellery as a final accessory. Gigi left her apartment in jeans and shirt and blazer as she walked to the Tom Ford Fashion Show (Picture: T.Jackson/Backgrid) The model seemed unfazed by the cameras as she headed to walk the runway (Picture: JosiahW / BACKGRID) Gigi looked sensational in a sequinned cut out dress on the runway (Picture: SplashNews.com) On the runway, Gigi transformed into a 70s-style disco queen, wearing a dramatic sequin dress alongside her sister, Bella Hadid. The sisters walked with Joan Smalls, as a host of famous faces watched on including Brooklyn Beckham and his wife, Nicola Peltz, as well as fellow model and supermodel Kate Moss’ daughter, Lila Grace Moss. The striking dress was a showstopper (Picture: Giovanni Giannoni/WWD via Getty Images) The sensational dress was reminiscent of 1970’s disco fashion (Picture: Taylor Hill/WireImage) Gigi’s hair was draped over her shoulders to showcase the halter neckline and the oversized matching earrings (Picture: P Yim/Getty Images for NYFW: The Shows) Gigi has recently been linked to Leonardo DiCaprio (Picture: Jeff Kravitz/FilmMagic) Her hair was disco fabulous with tight curls and crimps that added major volume to her blonde locks. Gigi’s glamorous display on the runway comes several days after she was reportedly seen cosying up to the recently single, Leo, who recently split from girlfriend Camila Morrone. news.title: SC bench expresses displeasure in order over new case listing system
news.text: A Supreme Court bench in a rare instance has expressed displeasure in its judicial order over a new case listing mechanism introduced by Chief Justice U U Lalit for speedy disposal of matters pending for yearsA bench headed by Sanjay Kishan Kaul the number three judge in seniority at present in the apex court while hearing a criminal case passed the order quotThe new listing system is not giving an adequate time to take up matters fixed for hearing like the present case as there are number of matters within the span of Afternoon39 sessionquotThe bench which passed the order on September 13 listed the matter for hearing on November 15Under the new mechanism the judges of the top court are working in two different shiftsThe new system stipulates that on Monday and Friday of every week 30 judges are to sit in a combination of two and deal with over 60 miscellaneous matters of each bench including the fresh PILsThe new mechanism also stipulates that on Tuesday Wednesday and Thursday the judges will sit in a combination of three judges and would first in morning session take detailed hearing matters which are generally old cases pending for years till 1 pmIn the post lunch session afternoon session the judges will sit in a combination of two judges and would start taking first the matters related to transfer petitions related to transfer of cases from one jurisdiction to other and then fresh matters including PILs followed by 30 to 20 cases which are after notice matters till 4 pmAccording to sources the top court with the new system in place has managed to dispose of over 5000 cases in total since Justice Lalit took over as the Chief Justice on August 27In 13 working days of the top court since CJI Lalit was sworn in it has disposed of over 3500 miscellaneous matters over 250 regular hearing matters and over 1200 transfer petitionsEarlier this week during a hearing of the matter Justice D Y Chandrachud who is next in line to become Chief Justice of India said it has been decided that from next week there will be one consolidated list of after notice matters which will run through the whole week for a benchThe move is likely to reduce adjournments sought by lawyers who often claim that the matter was listed at the eleventh hour after remaining pending for months and years and therefore they could not prepare for the caseOnly the news.title: Microsofts app allows real-time document signing during team meetings
news.text: Tech giant Microsoft has created a sample app for teams that allow people to sign documents during remote meetingsAccording to Windows Central the application lets users add a document to a meeting for attendees to sign such as a purchase agreement invoice or NDAThe sample app was made by Teams Ecosystem Engineering as a proof of concept aimed at independent software vendors ISVs or other customers implementing itThe entire project is available and documented on GitHub which should help organisations that would like to use it within meetings the report saidThe app allows users to add a document to a meeting to be reviewed or signed by attendees It supports Teams single sign on SSO for authenticationThe report mentioned that it also supports sharing content during a meeting stage adaptive cards and the Teams people pickerMicrosoft noted that the app could be adapted to work with other scenarios that require signing off such as reviewing and approving code or working together on a documentThe sample app is currently available for desktop clients of Teams Mobile and web support is on the way though Microsoft did not specify when in its Tech Community post announcing the feature the report saidCurrently the app only works with users from the same organisation or tenant Guest and anonymous user support are also on the way it added IANSvcdpbOnly the headline and picture of this report may have been reworked by the Business Standard staff the rest of the content is auto generated from a syndicated feed
news.author: Teams Ecosystem Engineering
